title: MCP Integration Requirements Summary
body_html:
Based on my initial research, here's a summary of MCP integration requirements:

  • Standardized Protocol: MCP (Model Context Protocol) is an open protocol that standardizes interactions between applications and AI models.
  • Single Integration Point: It allows for a single integration point, rather than custom implementations for each data source.
  • Host Process: A host process manages the lifecycle of the MCP protocol, coordinating interactions.
  • Client Requirements: MCP clients need to handle core functions like prompt management, tool use, and data handling.
  • Server Implementation: MCP servers can be built to expose specific functionalities, like accessing databases or running code.
  • Extensibility: The protocol is designed to be extensible, supporting features like prompts, tools, and sampling.
